intro: Kengyilia leiantha, commonly known as the blue poppy, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It is characterized by its striking blue-violet petals and is part of the Papaveraceae family. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
